</center>

Below are links to my various published papers and their related github pages.

Many of my papers come from having been a contributor of the COVID-19 Genomics UK Consortium at The University of Liverpool ([source](https://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/ukgwa/20230522153320/https://www.cogconsortium.uk/cog-uk/consortium-partners/university-of-liverpool/)).


### Comparison of different microbiome analysis pipelines to validate their reproducibility of gastric mucosal microbiome composition

Link: [https://journals.asm.org/doi/10.1128/msystems.01358-24](https://journals.asm.org/doi/10.1128/msystems.01358-24)

## 2024

### Optimised human stool sample collection for multi-omic microbiota analysis

Link: [https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-024-67499-4](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-024-67499-4)

R Code Bookdown: [https://m-gemmell.github.io/Gemmell_et_al_2023/01-Intro.html](https://m-gemmell.github.io/Gemmell_et_al_2023/01-Intro.html)

## 2023

### The Hypolimnas misippus genome supports a common origin of the W chromosome in Lepidoptera

### The ecology of viruses in urban rodents with a focus on SARS-CoV-2

## 2021

Link: [https://www.cell.com/cell-reports/pdf/S2211-1247(21)00663-X.pdf](https://www.cell.com/cell-reports/pdf/S2211-1247(21)00663-X.pdf)

### Changes in symptomatology, reinfection, and transmissibility associated with the SARS-CoV-2 variant B.1.1.7: an ecological study

### Exponential growth, high prevalence of SARS-CoV-2, and vaccine effectiveness associated with the Delta variant

Link: [https://www.science.org/doi/full/10.1126/science.abl9551](https://www.science.org/doi/full/10.1126/science.abl9551)

### The impact of viral mutations on recognition by SARS-CoV-2 specific T cells

Link: [https://www.cell.com/iscience/pdf/S2589-0042(21)01322-5.pdf](https://www.cell.com/iscience/pdf/S2589-0042(21)01322-5.pdf)

### Combined epidemiological and genomic analysis of nosocomial SARS-CoV-2 infection early in the pandemic and the role of unidentified cases in transmission

Link: [https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1198743X21004353](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1198743X21004353)

### Amplicon and Metagenomic Analysis of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) Coronavirus and the Microbiome in Patients with Severe MERS

Link: [https://journals.asm.org/doi/full/10.1128/msphere.00219-21](https://journals.asm.org/doi/full/10.1128/msphere.00219-21)
